meanings.definition: A person who rejects or denies the existence of objective reality.
meanings.sent1: The antirealist argued that reality is just a product of our minds.
meanings.sent2: She became an antirealist after studying different philosophical perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The antirealist joked that they live in a world of their own creation.
meanings.sent4: His view as an antirealist painted the world in shades of subjectivity.
meanings.sent5: The concept of an antirealist challenges traditional beliefs about reality.

meanings.definition: A philosophical position that denies the existence of an objective reality.
meanings.sent1: In his essay, he explored the implications of being an antirealist.
meanings.sent2: The antirealist's arguments shook the foundations of traditional philosophy.
meanings.sent3: The antirealist's perspective on reality sparked intense debates among scholars.
meanings.sent4: Her stance as an antirealist made her question everything she once believed.
meanings.sent5: The idea of an antirealist challenges the very notion of a shared reality.

meanings.definition: Not conforming to or representing reality.
meanings.sent1: The painting had an antirealist style, with distorted shapes and colors.
meanings.sent2: His antirealist novel took readers on a journey through a surreal world.
meanings.sent3: The movie's antirealist portrayal of history left the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: Her antirealist interpretation of the events was both fascinating and perplexing.
meanings.sent5: The artist's antirealist approach challenged viewers to see beyond the ordinary.
